page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: The land section located to Western Rd Cp school lies west of the county Town of Lewes and parallel to the Brighton/Lewes railway. It is predominantly a downland location with a southern, sloping view and is used for corn production, cattle and sheep rearing and incorporates access to the South Downs Way. There are very few houses in the area but those that are belong mainly to the farming community. No other industry is to be found in this sector. It is a site of typical down_land features and possesses aesthetic rather than commercial value.
